meaningMnemonic:
A <kanji>stiff</kanji> <kanji>fix</kanji> is when you fix something to be stiff, which leads to <vocabulary>stiffness</vocabulary> or <vocabulary>stiffening</vocabulary>. 

硬直 commonly describes a person's body becoming stiff in response to stimuli such as discomfort or shock, or after death.
readingMnemonic: This is a jukugo word that uses the on'yomi readings of the kanji. You should be able to read this on your own.
